smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams found. All 19 pages contain at least one element. Every diagram has classes, tables, use cases, states, or activities present.

In use case diagram on page 2, 'Tuvasta kasutaja' appears to be an included/shared use case accessed via other use cases. In page 3, all use cases (Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, Aktiveeri auto, Muuda auto mittaktiivseks, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid, Unusta auto) are connected to actors Autode haldur and/or Juhataja. All use case ovals have at least one actor association.

No duplicate use case names describing the same activity with the same actor were found. Use cases like 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Vaata kõiki autosid', and 'Vaata autode koondaruannet' describe different viewing activities (active cars, all cars, summary report) and are not duplicates.

In the package diagram on page 1, all element names within each package are unique. For example, 'Klassifikaatorite register' contains Auto_kategooria, Auto_kategooria_tüüp, Auto_kütuse_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_seisundi_liik, etc. - all distinct names.

Reviewing database diagrams (pages 14-19), columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear in multiple tables but represent different contexts (e.g., nimetus for Riik vs nimetus for Auto_mark). Common columns like 'isik_id' are connected via FK relationships. No redundant data storage without FK relationship was identified.

All use cases follow consistent verb-first naming pattern. Page 2: 'Tuvasta kasutaja' (Identify), 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid' (View), 'Vaata kõiki autosid' (View), 'Vaata autode koondaruannet' (View). Page 3: 'Registreeri auto' (Register), 'Lõpeta auto' (Terminate), 'Muuda autot' (Modify), 'Aktiveeri auto' (Activate), 'Unusta auto' (Forget). All start with active verbs.

State diagram on page 9 shows states: Algus (initial), Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Lõpetatud, Unustatud. All states are reachable: Algus→Ootel (registration), Ootel→Aktiivne/Unustatud, Aktiivne→Mitteaktiivne/Lõpetatud, Mitteaktiivne→Aktiivne/Lõpetatud. Every state has at least one incoming transition path.

Activity diagram on page 4 shows all actions are reachable from Algus (start): Algus→'Vaata kõiki autosid, mida saab lõpetada'→decision→'Otsi autot' or continue→'Vali auto'→'Lõpeta valitud auto'→decision→loop or Lõpp. All actions have incoming flows from the start node.

All relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators on both ends. For example, page 5: Isik-Autod shows '1' and '0..*'. Page 14: Isik-Kasutajakonto shows '1' and '0..1'. Page 17: Auto-Auto_kategooria_omamine shows '1' and '0..*'. Page 19: Tootaja-Tootaja_rolli_omamine shows '1' and '0..*'. All relationships specify multiplicity at both ends.

Counted central elements per diagram: Page 2: 4 use cases. Page 3: 7 use cases. Page 5: 3 classes. Page 6: 6 classes. Page 7: 6 classes. Page 8: 6 classes. Page 9: 6 states. Page 10: 5 classes. Page 11: 3 classes. Page 12: 7 classes. Page 13: 3 classes. Page 14: 4 tables. Page 15: 9 tables (Tootaja_roll, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_kytuse_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_kategooria). Page 16: 3 tables. Page 17: 6 tables. Page 18: 2 tables. Page 19: 5 tables. Maximum is 9 on page 15. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

Counted visual connection lines per element on each diagram. Page 17 (Autode register Klassifikaator): Auto has 5 visible lines (to Auto_kategooria_omamine, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_omamine). Page 19 (Tootajate register): Tootaja has 4 visible lines (to Isik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, self-mentor, Tootaja_rolli_omamine). Maximum connection count is 5. Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows related elements are positioned near each other. No relationship spans more than twice the average distance between elements. Elements are well-organized within their respective diagrams with consistent spacing.

All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs. Page 2-3 use cases: Tuvasta (Identify), Vaata (View), Registreeri (Register), Lõpeta (Terminate), Muuda (Modify), Aktiveeri (Activate), Unusta (Forget). Page 4 activity actions: Vaata (View), Otsi (Search), Vali (Select), Lõpeta (Terminate). All begin with active verb forms in Estonian.

Checked all names. Class names: Isik (4), Riik (4), Auto (4), Autod (5), Klient (6). Shortest attribute: mudel (5), kood (4 in compound names like auto_kood). All class, table, attribute, and use case names have ≥4 characters. Threshold is ≤3. No names have 3 or fewer characters, therefore smell is NOT present.

The class 'Autod' (appearing on pages 5, 11, 12) is plural. In Estonian, 'Autod' means 'Cars' (plural of 'Auto'). Class names should be singular (e.g., 'Auto' not 'Autod'). This violates the rule requiring class names to be singular.

All attribute and column names start with lowercase letters. Examples from page 14: isik_id, isikukood, riik_kood, e_meil, synni_kp, reg_aeg, eesnimi, perenimi. Page 17: auto_kood, nimetus, mudel, reg_number, vin_kood. No uppercase-starting attribute or column names found.

All database table names are singular. Page 14: Isik, Kasutajakonto. Page 15: Tootaja_roll, Auto_kategooria, Riik, etc. Page 17: Auto (not Autod), Auto_kategooria_omamine. Page 19: Tootaja, Tootaja_rolli_omamine. Note: The conceptual class 'Autod' becomes 'Auto' in database diagrams, which is correct singular form.

No disallowed type prefixes found. Prefixes like PK_, FK_, pfK, IXFK_ appear in database diagrams but these are explicitly allowed per the rule for indicating primary keys, foreign keys, and indexes. No tbl_, uc_, str, int, or similar type prefixes were found in class, table, or attribute names.
